name: A. Minimal Coprime
statement:
A segment of positive integers [l,r] is called if l and r are coprime^{
text{ }}.A coprime segment [l,r] is called if it does not contain^{
text{ }} any coprime segment not equal to itself. To better understand
this statement, you can refer to the notes.Given [l,r], a segment of
positive integers, find the number of minimal coprime segments contained
in [l,r].^{
text{ }}Two integers a and b are coprime if they share only one positive
common divisor. For example, the numbers 2 and 4 are not coprime because
they are both divided by 2 and 1, but the numbers 7 and 9 are coprime
because their only positive common divisor is 1.^{
text{ }}A segment [l’,r’] is contained in the segment [l,r] if and only
if l
le l’
le r’
le r.
solutions: #include<bits/stdc++.h>using namespace std;int t;int l,r;int main(){	cin>>t;	while(t--){		cin>>l>>r;		if(l==1 and r==1){			cout<<1<<"\n";			continue;		}		cout<<r-l<<"\n";	}}
